page.title: 14RELIGION
page.content: Mawgan Church was built between the second century and the thirteenth century.It has six bells.The local Vicar's name is the Reverent Long.On the main entrance there is a dog door which was used for letting dogs in and out.In the Lady Chapel there is a stone effigy of Sir Roger De Carrinou and his widow Lady Johanna who were descendants of King Arthur.Near that there is a small cross with a light beneath it.It is always lit up because the sacrificial is in the Lady Chapel.In the vestry, there are a few original stones dating from the 13th.C.The Rev.Long put a cross there to commemorate finding the stones.The church is built of granite blocks.The arches are built with a keystone and the pillars are made of porcelain stone.Mawgan is a very welcoming church.
